glsa.title: NBD Tools: Buffer overflow in NBD server
glsa.synopsis: The NBD server is vulnerable to a buffer overflow that may result in the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: The NBD Tools are the Network Block Device utilities allowing one to use remote block devices over a TCP/IP network. It includes a userland NBD server.

description.p: Kurt Fitzner discovered that the NBD server allocates a request buffer that fails to take into account the size of the reply header.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a malicious request that can result in the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the NBD server.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
